reviews.review_msg: Professor Yang is really helpful outside lecture hours and is really friendly as well. She answers outside of class hours fairly quickly. The main issue is that the class moves really quick and her slides don't really explain much. She uses another's prof's format/structure so there's little room for error. The content is really interesting though.
Tough course but Yupin did a good job explaining concepts and was extremely helpful. Her accent can make it tough to understand her at first, but she paces a difficult course well!

I was excited to take this class, but was very disappointed with Yupin's teaching. I am sure she is very knowledgeable, but her ability to teach students (who are new to R-studio) is below standard. Her lectures feel all over the place - it seems like she is always second guessing herself while speaking it's frustrating. I would not recommend her!

Probably the biggest workload course I've had at SFU. She apparently uses a different profs structure so she doesn't give any room to breathe. There are weeks where she assigns multiple things that are due in very close time frames. It feels as though she disregards all other courses students are taking and forces you to shift all focus to hers.

While Yupin is a great person, the majority of her lectures are unrelated to her assignments. Her lectures explain the theoretical side of things but do not help at all with the application. All the graded assignments and quizzes don't really relate to her lectures and you're left to learn on your own costing marks. Averages were low for the class

All the assignments are based off a software called R Studio. It's a fairly difficult software to use for first timers. The issue is that the lectures do not teach you anything about how to use R Studio and you're kind of just thrown into the water and forced to figure out how to use it yourself. Having no lab makes this class very hard.

Hard class, the book should never be published, filled with mistakes and try reading it 3 times, you'd still get confused, everyone complained about it.He won't help much,he will say so that its fair to everyone.How is being fair mean not explaining things properly to students.He won't mark assignments till after final,so that u repeat mistakes.

Dr. Krider adapted this course to online very well. Weekly labs/assignments/readings were reasonable length and well connected. The R programming was well explained and shouldn't scare you away. The marking was timely and fair.

My favourite prof at SFU so far (by far). He is engaging, has witty humour, and knows his stuff. The course isnt easy, reading through the tutorials and weekly readings is a MUST. Weekly quizzes are based on readings, and fair. 2 large projects, dont underestimate the time these will take. He's a fair grader, but you will need to work for marks.

Not sure why the previous poster feels that way. While not the most dynamic speaker, he gets the point across well enough. The class structure is fairly repetitive in that material is repeated in the text, lecture and lab, but it helps reinforce your skills. Probably the least demanding 400-level class. No surprises on assignments or exams.

Useless professor. I dont have a single good thing to say about him. If you want to take this class i suggest a different professor Jason Ho would be 50 times better. This guy doesnt know a thing about the class he teaches. Useless

Excellent class.  All assn's were turned in electronically - doesn't waste paper, great for a granola like me.  Facinating stuff, albeit a little too black-box for my liking.  For anyone with a marketing/stats mind, take this class!!!
He's one of the best profs in Marketing
Most thought provoking professor I've ever had

He's great! Very knowledgeable and engaging. His class is one of the few classes at Beedie, that I would say really have important real-world application, and not just concepts and keywords to throw out there.  He's also super helpful in tutorials, and really cares about the students. Very organized. A bit goofy, and endearing.
